BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
A’ WING , JANPATH  BHAWAN , 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
Date: 26 /12/2008 
 
CIRCULAR NO.  17 /2008 
 
Sub: Carriage of weapons by SPG personnel while on duty. 
 
 
This AVSEC Circular is in continuation to the BCAS Circular No.29/2002 dated 
24.9.2002 which is regarding carriage of weapons in civil flights. 
 
2. 
All SPG personnel (Special Protection Group, Government of India), while on 
official duty for protecting their protectees (those persons who are given SPG protection 
cover by the Government of India), when traveling by civil flights on duty where such 
civil aircraft does not have separate storage facility for the hold baggage, then the 
concerned airline operator shall create a facility of a safe, strong and  lockable container 
for carriage of arms and ammunition immediately as prescribed by Circular No.29/2002 – 
Para 5 (vi) dated 24.9.2002.  This facility shall be provided within a period of 30 days of 
receipt of this circular. Till such a facility is created by the airline operator, the SPG 
personnel are hereby allowed, as a special case, to carry their weapon on board the flight 
in an unloaded condition where the arms and ammunition are kept separately in their 
hand baggage. Once the secure facility is created, the arms and ammunition will be 
carried separately in the hold baggage only. 
 
3. 
Security Officer of airlines concerned shall be responsible to inform the sky 
marshal on board, if any, about the presence of such SPG personnel before the 
commencement of the flight. 
 
4. 
The Station Manager/Airport Manager of the concerned airline shall verify all the 
relevant documents to ensure that the arms are authorized alongwith their number in the 
name of the SPG personnel concerned.  He shall also verify the identity of such SPG 
personnel before the pre-embarkation security check. 
 
5. 
All other provisions of BCAS Circular No.29/2002 dated 24.9.2002 shall remain 
unchanged. 
 
 
 
 
(D.S. Chauhan)
